last_episode_to_air.name: Celebrity Holiday Bricktacular: Let It Snow; Brickmas Carols
last_episode_to_air.overview: Returning fan-favorites contestants David Guedes, Caleb Schilling, Krystle Starr and Randal Wilson, and celebrities NeNe Leaks, Marshawn Lynch, Kelly Osbourne and Rob Riggle pair together to compete in holiday-themed challenges.

name: LEGO Masters
overview: Teams of LEGO enthusiasts go head-to-head, with infinite possibilities and an unlimited supply of LEGO bricks. Teams of two will compete against each other in ambitious brick-building challenges to be crowned the country's most talented amateur LEGO builders.  Based on the hit British reality-competition series of the same name.
tagline: A competition built like no other.

episodes.name: Dream Park Theme Park
episodes.overview: The pairs of contestants are introduced; each duo must craft one section of a theme park.

episodes.name: Space Smash
episodes.overview: Each duo must create a space-themed build; the creations are smashed in slow motion.

episodes.name: Cut in Half
episodes.overview: Each team builds the other half of an everyday object that has been sliced in two.

episodes.name: Movie Genres
episodes.overview: Phil Lord and Christopher Miller task the contestants with a movie-themed challenge.

episodes.name: Mega City Block
episodes.overview: The contests each build a city block that is brought together as a huge city at the end.

episodes.name: Need for Speed / Super-Bridges
episodes.overview: The remaining teams must build a car and a strong bridge; the creations are stress tested.

episodes.name: Storybook
episodes.overview: The contestants must interpret a story that is read aloud from a book selected for this competition.

episodes.name: Good Vs. Evil
episodes.overview: Contestants create evil lairs and fly vehicles through their Lego worlds; actor Terry Crews.

episodes.name: Star Wars
episodes.overview: Contestants build droids and replicate iconic scenes inspired by the "Star Wars" franchise.

episodes.name: Finals
episodes.overview: The two remaining duos go head-to-head as they create their most epic master builds yet.

episodes.name: LEGO Day Parade
episodes.overview: The talented teams are introduced and tasked with building an eye-catching float in the first-ever LEGO Day Parade.

episodes.name: Hero Shot!
episodes.overview: Teams put a stunt "minifigure" to the test in an explosive stunt action scene. The duos must craft an immersive build filled with slime, water, glitter and colored dust to create the ultimate action movie moment.

episodes.name: Make and Shake
episodes.overview: Structural integrity and beauty come together in the most earth-shattering challenge, as teams build a structure strong enough to withstand an earthquake; which designs perform the best and pass the LEGO "brickter scale" rating system.

episodes.name: Hats Incredible!
episodes.overview: This week's challenge is the ultimate test in ingenuity and engineering, as teams will create incredible and wearable hats made entirely of LEGO bricks. Then, teams must model their designs on the LEGO runway, hoping their creations don't collapse into pieces.

episodes.name: One Floating Brick
episodes.overview: As the competition heightens, the remaining contestants are expected to raise the stakes and elevate their work - quite literally - when the teams are tasked with building a beautiful structure in mid-air. Building tables will be removed from the LEGO workspace and duos will be challenged to create a build of their choosing from the foundation of one floating LEGO technic brick. Discover who will take LEGO to new heights.

episodes.name: Puppet Masters
episodes.overview: The remaining six duos pull all the strings as they build their very own puppets in just under 10 hours; teams collaborate with one another to bring their puppets to life in a puppet show.

episodes.name: Land & Sea
episodes.overview: The remaining five duos are split into individual challenges; five must build land creatures, while their partners make creations inspired by the sea.

episodes.name: Flip My Block
episodes.overview: The teams are challenged to take the lamest LEGO neighborhoods and create an action-packed dream house in a home renovation-inspired game.

episodes.name: Cliffhanger!
episodes.overview: The teams must build a gravity-defying castle off a giant LEGO cliff.

episodes.name: Master Build -- Day & Night
episodes.overview: The three remaining teams have 24 hours to make a construction that has both a day and a night look; the winner is revealed and receives the $100,000 prize.

episodes.name: Ready to Launch
episodes.overview: Teams are introduced and tasked with a space-themed challenge...building personalized spaceships.

episodes.name: Jurass-brick World
episodes.overview: The contestants bring dinosaurs and special effects to life in their "Jurassic World: Dominion"-inspired builds; actor Chris Pratt makes a guest appearance.

episodes.name: Brickin' Bull Ride Rodeo
episodes.overview: The builders embrace the Wild West and their technical abilities by creating bull-riding characters.

episodes.name: Out on a Limb
episodes.overview: The builders make their childhood dreams come true by building an imaginative treehouse with their younger selves in mind.

episodes.name: Brickminster Dog Show
episodes.overview: Man's best friend in bricks! Each team races to pick which furry friend they'll recreate.

episodes.name: Pirate Ships Ahoy!
episodes.overview: The teams have just eight hours to create a pirate ship with a creative and cohesive story about its captain and the treasure they're in search of. At the end of the challenge, the builders dock their ships to see how their creations hold up against the rest of the fleet.

episodes.name: Camp Click-a-Brick
episodes.overview: The teams put an imaginative and dynamic twist on a summer camp theme.

episodes.name: Mini Golf Masters
episodes.overview: Each team must transform a putting green into a playable mini golf hole.

episodes.name: Wrecking Balls to the Wall
episodes.overview: The contestants build tall, strong and stylish castles using only regular bricks.

episodes.name: Marvel Masters
episodes.overview: The teams recreate iconic action-packed scenes from the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

episodes.name: Start Your Engines
episodes.overview: Contestants are split into teams, where they compete to build a fast and fashionable race car.

episodes.name: Water Works
episodes.overview: The teams have 10 hours to build a fountain that uses water to create movement within their build.

episodes.name: Finale: Master Build
episodes.overview: The three remaining teams get 24 hours to build their best creation possible.

episodes.name: Celebrity Holiday Bricktacular: Soaring Snowmobiles
episodes.overview: Robin Thicke, Finesse Mitchell, Leslie Jordan and Cheryl Hines build aerodynamic snowmobiles.

episodes.name: Celebrity Holiday Bricktacular: Sleigh It!
episodes.overview: The teams must build Santa a new sleigh that looks great and is tough enough to span across two chimneys filled with heavy holiday gifts.

episodes.name: Celebrity Holiday Bricktacular: Finale
episodes.overview: The teams compete in two super-sized brick-building challenges; the winning team wins $20,000 for the charity of its choice.

episodes.name: Brick Lake
episodes.overview: The daring duos embark on a mission to construct the ultimate motorized party boat that showcases their unique personalities.

episodes.name: Catropolis
episodes.overview: The builders must make pet palaces for kittens.

episodes.name: Volcanic Brickruptions
episodes.overview: The builders must skillfully construct a scene inspired by their chosen biome while including an explosion and a compelling narrative.

episodes.name: Build It by Ear
episodes.overview: The builders must choose from a selection of sound effects and transform what they think their sound would look like into a LEGO model.

episodes.name: Cirque du Soleil
episodes.overview: The duos divide into two big teams to construct a mesmerizing show consisting of four breathtaking acts.

episodes.name: Is It Brick?
episodes.overview: The builders ransack a detective's office and leave with an item of their choice that they must replicate into a one-to-one scale model; "LEGO Masters" Season 3 winner, Stacey Roy, must play detective and spot which items are real.

episodes.name: Brick Chic
episodes.overview: Teams must make luxurious bags that are both functional and runway-worthy by showcasing their creations in a photo shoot; show-stopping bags secure a coveted magazine cover and the fashion fails are at risk of elimination.

episodes.name: LEGO 2K Drive
episodes.overview: Teams use bricks to create an off-road remote-controlled vehicle for an ultimate race.

episodes.name: Roller Coaster Madness
episodes.overview: The pairs are tasked with creating a roller coaster that incorporates a mechanical lift and a drop.

episodes.name: Bricks & All
episodes.overview: Counting down the top 100 moments from four seasons of "LEGO Masters."

episodes.name: Four-Ever Finale
episodes.overview: The three remaining teams must create a massive build complete with storytelling and creativity.

episodes.name: Celebrity Holiday Bricktacular: Candy Cane Express; Holiday Blockbusters
episodes.overview: Returning fan-favorites contestants David Guedes, Caleb Schilling, Krystle Starr and Randal Wilson, and celebrities NeNe Leaks, Marshawn Lynch, Kelly Osbourne and Rob Riggle pair together to compete in holiday-themed challenges.

episodes.name: Celebrity Holiday Bricktacular: Let It Snow; Brickmas Carols
episodes.overview: Returning fan-favorites contestants David Guedes, Caleb Schilling, Krystle Starr and Randal Wilson, and celebrities NeNe Leaks, Marshawn Lynch, Kelly Osbourne and Rob Riggle pair together to compete in holiday-themed challenges.
